page.title: 12TO BE YOUNG IN BASSINGBOURN
page.content: {Childhood is learning, the first step, {Trying to do harder and harder things, {Learning who's boss, you or your dad, {Using your anger in the right places, {Not crying or sulking but obeying { first time, {Enjoying life to the full, instead of { being cooped up, {Being free without a care of what's { happening, {Childhood is enjoying, laughing and { LEARNING. { }By Gary Lewis (Age 11) There are lots of constructive and helpful places in the village for young people. Starting at the regular clinic in the college right up to the secondary school you get care for your health and abilities. There are areas in the village for children to play in e.g. the recreation ground. Also there are areas at the Barracks to play in.
